executive_summary: Tom Hayes is extremely bullish, particularly on value stocks, international equities, and the housing recovery. He emphasizes the importance of identifying companies with strong fundamentals that are temporarily mispriced due to market overreactions. He highlights opportunities in Alibaba, Cooper Standard, QXO, Stanley Black & Decker, and Generac, among others. He believes the market is transitioning from a growth-dominated phase to one where value and international equities will outperform.

key_reasons: Earnings growth is double what was expected.

macro_thesis_summary: The market is transitioning from a growth-dominated phase to one where value and international equities will outperform. The good news is there are a lot of trapped bears out there. Each new trade deal is forcing them to buy. The market is going higher.
